meanings.sent1: The flowers on the bush were fasciculate, growing closely together in small groups.
meanings.sent2: The fasciculate leaves of the plant made it look very dense and compact.
meanings.sent3: The fasciculate arrangement of pencils on the desk made it easy to find the one he needed.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were fasciculate, clustered tightly together in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The fasciculate pattern of stars in the sky created a beautiful cluster of light.

meanings.definition: To form into bundles or clusters.
meanings.sent1: She tried to fasciculate the wires neatly to avoid any tangles.
meanings.sent2: The spider began to fasciculate its web, weaving the strands together skillfully.
meanings.sent3: He decided to fasciculate his socks in pairs to keep them organized.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to fasciculate magically on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The chef started to fasciculate the herbs, tying them together for easy use in cooking.
